title: ISSS608-Liu Chih Yuan
text:
by Liu Chih Yuan
This page is dedicated for documenting work exercises and notes for ISSS608 Visual Analytics

Fun Fact: Cabbages are veggies



Sidebar added
Navbar with github
Picture of cabbage

title: Hands-on_Exercise 1
text:
The code chunk below uses p_load() of pacman package to check if tidyverse packages are installed in this computer. If they are, then they will be launched into R.
Pacman is like a package manager, Tidyverse are packages for data science eg. plotting, wrangling, cleaning, visualization etc

pacman::p_load(tidyverse)




Note if you did not run the first code chunk tidyverse, this will indicate not found. read_csv is a code from tidyverse
Looks very much like what we are doing in Pandas pd.read()

exam_data <- read_csv("data/Exam_data.csv")

Rows: 322 Columns: 7
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr (4): ID, CLASS, GENDER, RACE
dbl (3): ENGLISH, MATHS, SCIENCE

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

title: ISSS608-Liu Chih Yuan

Navbar with github
Picture of cabbage

title: Session Note Week 1
text:
Session notes will be documenting the notes and learning points made during the hands-on exercise


.qmd (Quarto Markdown): for content, dashboards
.yml (Config/settings): metadata, layouts, options
Use for maintain all the deliverables (eg. projects & exercise)



When you make changes of your qmd / yml it will be first shown in git
Usual changes: save (either qmd / yml) -> render (note this changes locally only)
To upload to GitHub, we have to “push” the files

Press Git on top right block
Select all files
Commit and leave comment eg. commit after adding a cabbage image
Press Push
Check on your GitHub see if uploaded



Push Rejected: your local brand was “behind” the remote

This happens when:

Created a new repo on GitHub, it auto generates a README, LICENSE etc
When you try to push without pulling those remote changer first
Local version doesn’t know about those remote commits so it says: do a git pull first to sync then can push





How Git Pull & Push works

Pull: download files from GitHub -> your local
Push: send files from local -> GitHub

How to avoid this error

Don’t initialize with README etc
If did so, always Pull before you Push
